TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F. Austin to J. R. Poinsett, 11-03-1827

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to J. R. Poinsett, November 3, 1827. Transmitting petition from David G. Burnet asking permit to establish a colony from Ohio in the border reserve. Exclusion of slavery checks immigration from Southern States; presumes the Government will encourage movement from the free States.

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to J. R. Poinsett, November 3, 1827. Transmitting petition from David G. Burnet asking permit to establish a colony from Ohio in the border reserve. Exclusion of slavery checks immigration from Southern States; presumes the Government will encourage movement from the free States.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Saltillo*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="11-03-1827">November 3, 1827*/date_mentioned* */p* *p**person_mentioned*Hon. J. R Poinsett*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*Sir—¦ At the request of my friend *person_mentioned*Mr David G. Burnet*/person_mentioned* of *location_mentioned*Ohio */location_mentioned*I inclose you two letters of recommendation, one from the *person_mentioned*Hon. H. Clay*/person_mentioned* and the other from the *person_mentioned*Hon. E. A. Brown.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr. Burnet*/person_mentioned* has obtained from the *person_mentioned*Gov't of this *location_mentioned*State */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*authority to colonise a district of *location_mentioned*Country lyying west of Nacogdoches*/location_mentioned* and as it is a small strip he wishes to annex to it a *location_mentioned*portion of country ex- tending East from said village to the Sabine river,*/location_mentioned* but as this latter is embraced *location_mentioned*within the twenty border leagues reserved by the Colonization Act*/location_mentioned*, it cannot be colonized without the previous permission of the *person_mentioned*President */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Mr. Burnet*/person_mentioned* has presented a memorial to that effect which goes on by this mail to the *person_mentioned*minister of relations*/person_mentioned* recommended by this Gov't.*/p*
*p*His object in directing his attention to this enterprise is to settle a number of reputable *person_mentioned*farmers */person_mentioned*from the *location_mentioned*State of Ohio*/location_mentioned*, who find it inconvenient to provide lands in that *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*for their large and increasing *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*owing to its excessively high price. The morality, industry and agricultural enterprise which characterize the *person_mentioned*inhabitants of *location_mentioned*Ohio */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*are well known and proverbial, slavery is unknown amongst them, they are " principled " against it, every man is a *person_mentioned*laborer*/person_mentioned*, and in this particular to their other recommend able qualities, they unite a principle which is in strict accordance with the broad ideas of liberty and universal emancipation laid down in the State Constitutions, and so strenuously urged in legislative deliberations—*/p*
*p*The restrictions as to Slavery in this *location_mentioned*State */location_mentioned*present very material obstacles to the settlement of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*by *person_mentioned*emigrants from the *location_mentioned*southern States*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, and should it be the wish of the *person_mentioned*Mexican Gov't,*/person_mentioned* to convert that fine portion of its *location_mentioned*territory */location_mentioned*from a *location_mentioned*savage wilderness */location_mentioned*and useless dead burthen on the *location_mentioned*nation*/location_mentioned*, to a populous, civilized and cultivated state capable of contributing a material quota towards national incomer wealth and prosperity, sound policy, and expediency I should presume would approve of a decided encouragement of *location_mentioned*Ohio*/location_mentioned* and other northern emigration. As regards national policy, I can see no objection to *person_mentioned*emigrants */person_mentioned*from our *location_mentioned*sister republic*/location_mentioned*, similitude of political institutions, unity of genl interests, absence of cause for a difference in local interests and enthusiastic love of liberty, present natural and mutual guarantees of perpetual harmony and peace between the two *location_mentioned*nations*/location_mentioned*. Not so with the *location_mentioned*nations of Europe*/location_mentioned*, who are, and must ever be the natural *person_mentioned*enemies of *location_mentioned*American */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*prosperity; and besides, the kind of *person_mentioned*emigrants */person_mentioned*that may be brought from *location_mentioned*Europe */location_mentioned*for colonizing purposes will not be of the class calculated to advance the *person_mentioned*lower orders of Society */person_mentioned*for the purpose of filling a contract, they will not in general possess the enterprise, perseverance and morality so indespensable to settle a wilderness, whereas *person_mentioned*emigrants */person_mentioned*from the *location_mentioned*north*/location_mentioned*, to these and many other good qualities will add Capital—such *person_mentioned*emigrants */person_mentioned*certainly cannot be compared with the overflowings of the redundant population of *location_mentioned*Europe*/location_mentioned*—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr. Burnet*/person_mentioned* is in *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned*and in obedience to his wishes, as well as to comply with my duty as a friend, I have troubled you with this letter, and solicit such aid with the minister of relations in favor of the application as may be consistent.*/p*
*p*I embrace this opportunity to present my warmest wishes for your health and happiness and big you to accept the assurance of respect and esteem with which I have the honor to remain your very Obt. Servt*/p*.
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned*—*/p* *p*P. S. Any communications relative to *person_mentioned*Mr Burnet*/person_mentioned*'s business which you may think proper to make will reach their destination directed to me " en la villa de*location_mentioned* San Felipe de Austin, Texas,*/location_mentioned* (por el *location_mentioned*Saltillo*/location_mentioned*)"*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Estevan F. Austin*/person_mentioned*.*/p* *p**date_mentioned n="11-05-1827">Nov. 5*/date_mentioned*—I enclose copies of *person_mentioned*Mr. Burnet*/person_mentioned*'s petition and the "in- forms " of the Govt.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*A.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
